text: The Laurence Olivier Award for Best Actor in a Supporting Role in a Musical is an annual award presented by The Society of London Theatre in recognition of achievements in commercial British theatre. The awards were established as the Society of West End Theatre Awards in 1976, and, renamed in 1984 in honour of English actor Lord Olivier. The award had been given as a singular award for Laurence Olivier Award for Best Performance in a Supporting Role in a Musical from 1991 to when it was separated for the first time for the 2015 awards. ==Winners and nominees== ===2010s=== {| class="wikitable" style="width:98%;" |- style="background:#bebebe;" ! style="width:10%;"| Year ! style="width:30%;"| Performer ! style="width:30%;"| Musical ! style="width:30%;"| Character |- ! rowspan="5" align="center"| 2015 |- style="background:#B0C4DE" | George Maguire | Sunny Afternoon | Dave Davies |- | Rolan Bell | Memphis | Delray |- | Ian Mcintosh | Beautiful | Barry Mann |- | Jason Pennycooke | Memphis | Bobby |- ! rowspan="5" align="center"| 2016 |- style="background:#B0C4DE" | David Bedella | In the Heights | Kevin Rosario |- | Dan Burton | rowspan="2"|Gypsy | Tulsa |- | Peter Davison | Herbie |- | Gavin Spokes | Guys and Dolls | Nicely Nicely Johnson |- ! rowspan="5" align="center"| 2017 |- style="background:#B0C4DE" | Adam J.
